author: MaximoTrinidad
body:
<!--

For Windows PowerShell 5.1 issues, suggestions, or feature requests please use the following link instead:
- Windows PowerShell [UserVoice](https://windowsserver.uservoice.com/forums/301869-powershell)

If it is a bug report:
- make sure you are able to repro it on the latest released version. 
You can install the latest version from https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases
- Search the existing issues.
- Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- Refer to the [known issues](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/KNOWNISSUES.md).
- Fill out the following repro template:

If it's not a bug, please remove the template and elaborate the issue in your own words.
-->

Under the "Get PowerShell' section all Download links are still pointing to RC2.  
I know this has been a recurring issue for some time but I got to post the issue.  

WorkAround
---------------
Get the downloads from the Release page: https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases

:)

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: Looks like this is already fixed in our release branch, just need to merge it back to master

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body:
This was resolved when the 6.0.0 branch was merged to master.
https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/commit/a08f3241a344220f64922584a562837f7600c6c7

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body: We always have a release issue open.  You can track our status on this using this issue:  https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/5833

title: PSCore6 - PowerShell Core landing page download links are wrong.
